required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Modified Rabbit Training Model for Establishing an Emergency Front of Neck Airway in Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Modified Rabbit Training Model for Establishing an Emergency Front of Neck Airway in Children

brief_summary.textblock:
A "cannot intubate, cannot oxygenate" (CICO) situation is rare in paediatric anaesthesia, but can always occur in children under certain emergency situations. There is a paucity of literature on specific procedures for securing an emergency invasive airway in children under the age of 6 years. A modified emergency Front Of Neck Access (eFONA) technique using a rabbit cadaver model was developed to teach invasive airway protection in a CICO situation in children.
After watching an instructional video of our eFONA technique (tracheotomy, initial intubation with Frova catheter over which an endotracheal tube is inserted), 29 anaesthesiologists will perform two separate attempts on rabbit cadavers. The primary outcome is the success rate and the performance time overall and in subgroups of trained and untrained participants.

primary_outcome.description: Correct positioning of the endotracheal tube in to the trachea
Time needed to complete the surgical tracheotomy

secondary_outcome.description: paratracheal placement of the ETT, perforation of the back wall or complete rupture of the trachea

clinical_study.condition: Emergency Front of Neck Airway in Children

arm_group.description: Trained participants completed our eFONA workshop within the last six month prior to participating in this study
Untrained participants had never taken part in our institutional eFONA workshop

study_pop.textblock: Anesthesiologists working at the department of Anesthesia at University Children's Hospital Zurich

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Anesthesiologists working at the department of Anesthesia at University Children's Hospital Zurich
Exclusion Criteria:
- n.a.

facility.name: University Childrens Hospital, Department of Anaesthesia and Children's Research Centre

clinical_study.keyword: Cannot intubate, cannot oxygenate in children
